title: Video emerges of second hero confronting Bondi gunman | ABC NEWS
description: After news spread of 43-year-old Ahmed Al Ahmed's brave intervention at the Bondi Beach terror attack, footage of a second hero has emerged on Chinese social media. The dashcam video shows a man running towards one of the gunmen and wrestling away his weapon. The vision ends after the man falls to the ground, with separate drone vision captured during the attack showing the same man lying motionless. Police have not publicly identified the man. title: Everything we know about the Bondi shooters | ABC News Daily podcast
description: Who could do such a thing? It’s the question Australians are asking after Sunday’s mass shooting at Bondi Beach.   How did they radicalise? Who did they associate with? And what drove them to plan and execute the worst terror attack in Australia’s history?   Today, investigative reporter Sean Rubinsztein-Dunlop on what we know about the shooters and the unresolved questions for our security services.   Featured:    Sean Rubinsztein-Dunlop, ABC investigative reporter

title: Canberra's Jewish community mourn victims of Bondi attack | ABC NEWS
description: The Bondi terrorist attack has horrified and terrified Canberra's Jewish community. Today, people left flowers and lit candles to remember the victims of the attack.  ACT Policing have vowed to increase their presence at Jewish sites in the capital. description: After a positive start, the ASX steadily lost ground across the session with energy and mining stocks the biggest losers. title: Bondi heroes and heartache as new footage emerges and loved ones mourned | ABC NEWS
description: *This video contains images that may disturb some viewers.* 00:00 Newly emerged dashcam footage shows another incident where a bystander confronted one of the Bondi terror attackers. Police have now confirmed the attacks appear to have been inspired by Islamic State, and that the father/son duo were trained in military-style tactics in the Philippines. 03:44 More details of the 15 lives brutally cut short in the attack, including a 10-year-old girl, are emerging. 05:56 NSW Premier Chris Minns pledges to make the state's gun laws the toughest in the country, saying he will recall parliament before Christmas to pass new legislation which could limit the number of guns a person can own. 07:55 Western Sydney man Ahmed Al Ahmed has been hailed a hero for disarming one attacker, before he was shot in the shoulder multiple times. During his stay in hospital awaiting surgery, he's already hosted a number of VIP visitors. 09:30 Security is being ramped up at Hanukkah events around the world, with questions being asked whether the Australian government could have done anything to stop the attacks. title: John Howard joins mounting criticism of govt response to antisemitism | ABC NEWS
description: Former prime minister John Howard has criticised the Albanese government's response to a rise in antisemitism and accused the prime minister of using a debate over gun laws as a distraction. Anthony Albanese is under growing pressure from the Jewish community as he seeks to keep Australia united in the wake of the Bondi Beach attack. title: Is social media to blame for rising antisemitism? | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Sunday's terror attack in Bondi has sent shockwaves around the world, with vigils held in places like the UK and US - countries that are also grappling with a rise in antisemitism. Author of 'Antisemitism, An American Tradition' Pamela Nadell tells The World's Girish Sawlani that social media is the "chief progenitor of antisemitism, not only in Australia and the US but around the world." title: Europe to launch international commission for Ukraine war damages | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Leaders including Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskyy arrived in The Hague on Tuesday to launch an International Claims Commission to compensate Kyiv for hundreds of billions of dollars in damage from Russian attacks and alleged war crimes. Human rights lawyer Oleksandra Matviichuk, who heads the Centre for Civil Liberties, which won the Nobel Peace Prize in 2022, tells The World's Girish Sawlani that breaking Russia's economy is what will help stop the war. title: How will Australia's gun laws change after Bondi? | The World | ABC NEWS
description: In the wake of the Bondi terrorist attack, state and territory leaders have unanimously agreed to strengthen gun controls. The National Cabinet is considering proposals to limit ownership further, restrict what guns are available for ownership, and how many a person can own. Professor Charles Watson from Gun Control Australia says the attack should make it next-to impossible to keep Australia's gun laws the way they are. title: AI and unchecked algorithms harming social cohesion, says expert | ABC NEWS
description: The Bondi attack saw social media flooded with misinformation and disinformation, in one instance from X's AI chatbot Grok which repeatedly misidentified a man captured in footage from the scene of the shooting. Alistair MacGibbon is the former national eSafety Commissioner, and he says social media companies and AI companies should be held responsible for a lack of social cohesion caused by the spread of misinformation. title: Bondi gunman's Indian family had no knowledge of his radicalisation, Indian police say | ABC News
description: Indian police say the dead gunman in the Bondi beach shooting, Sajid Akram, was originally from the southern Indian city of Hyderabad but had limited contact with his family in India.
